neighbors.name: Harbin Farm Enterprises Llc
neighbors.claims: Harbin Farm Enterprises Llc is registered in Kansas as a domestic limited liability company with no known active business operations beyond holding farmland [Kansas Secretary of State](https://www.kansas.gov/bess). The Harbin name is established locally (e.g., Harbin Construction, L.L.C. is a Salina-based firm), suggesting the LLC is tied to a local family farming enterprise [CorporationWiki](https://www.corporationwiki.com/Kansas/Salina/harbin-construction-llc/48471426.aspx). There are no public records of commercial transactions, liens, or projects involving Harbin Farm Enterprises Llc apart from land ownership, and it has no online presence or listed executives (implying a family-run entity) [Kansas Secretary of State](https://www.kansas.gov/bess).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local family business presence (Harbin construction firm) and significant farmland ownership in area

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Harbin family personally, emphasizing respect for their farming legacy and offering roles or benefits (e.g., contracting opportunities) that align with their economic interests to foster support.

neighbors.name: Bradshaw Business Properties Llc
neighbors.claims: Bradshaw Business Properties Llc is a Kansas-registered LLC that appears to function solely as a property holding entity without any operating business or local storefront [Kansas Secretary of State](https://www.kansas.gov/bess). The company’s only public footprint is in land records; it is listed as the owner of at least one parcel in Saline County, and no other business activities or community engagements are evident [Saline County GIS](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/gis-mapping). No online presence, employees, or industry filings are associated with this LLC, indicating it serves as a passive investment vehicle for real estate assets (likely managed by an individual or family named Bradshaw) [Kansas Secretary of State](https://www.kansas.gov/bess).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-town/absentee investor with no local operations; influence limited to property ownership

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the LLC’s principal (the Bradshaw owner) with a proposal that highlights substantial financial gains (e.g., premium buyout or lease terms) to align their profit motive with the project and preempt any opposition.

overview_summary: The neighboring entities consist mainly of small private agricultural interests and one landholding investor. Harbin Farm Enterprises LLC and the Tillberg trust indicate family farm operations with a focus on farming continuity, while Bradshaw Business Properties LLC appears to be a speculative land investment vehicle. None of these landowners have publicly declared a stance, but their motivations likely range from preserving agricultural use to maximizing land value.
